definition: a wild horse that refuses to be bridled (a metaphor for sth that runs wild)
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
bridle/reins/halter
variant of 韁|缰[jiang1]
erroneous variant of 野[ye3]
old variant of 野[ye3]
field/plain/open space/limit/boundary/rude/feral
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Zeal without knowledge is a runaway.
sentences.chinese: 没有知识的热情犹如脱缰野马。

sentences.english: The cowboy caught the runaway horse with a rope.
sentences.chinese: 那个牛仔用套索套住了那匹失控的脱缰野马。

sentences.english: The huge tornado kicked across the land like a wild bronco.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的龙卷风踢这片土地上宛如脱缰野马。

sentences.english: Justin and Audrey looked forward to everything and anything!
sentences.chinese: 小贝贝像是脱缰野马似的到处冲来冲去。

definition: to throw off the reins/runaway (horse)/fig. out of control
lit. a horse that has thrown off the reins (idiom); runaway horse/out of control
fast as lightning
feral horse/free-roaming horse/wild horse
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
Pentium (microprocessor by Intel)
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
(of torrents) rush down/pour down
proceeding at a tremendous pace/getting on like a house on fire
(of a watercourse) to breach its dike/(of dikes) to collapse
impossible to resist (idiom); an irresistible force
to criss-cross/to run unhindered across the whole country
to flee in disarray/to scatter
to flow at great speed/to pour/racing current
hurricane/violent reform or revolution/violent movement or force
tide
